name: Clin T
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with greatest extension.

**Note 2:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category (T1 or T2) based on the tumor size.

    Lesion(s) confined to dermis
    Minimal infiltration of dermis (Not invading tarsal plate, not at eyelid margin)
    Subcutaneous tissue (Through entire dermis, not invading tarsal plate, not at eyelid margin)
    Tumor invades tarsal plate, not at eyelid margin
    Tumor at eyelid margin
    Tumor involves full eyelid thickness

    Localized, NOS

**Note 3:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category.

**Note 4:**  Presence of tumor at eyelid margin takes priority over depth of invasion in dermis/tarsal plate; i.e., code 250 takes priority over codes 100-200.

**Note 5:**  Metastatic skin lesions are coded in distant metastasis.
rows:
Tumor more than 20 mm in greatest dimension or any
tumor that invades adjacent ocular or orbital structures
or any tumor with perineural invasion

Adjacent structures, including:
    Bulbar conjunctiva
    Globe
    Sclera
    Soft tissues of orbit

Bone/periosteum of orbit
Skeletal muscle
Underlying cartilage

Stated as T3a

Tumor whose complete resection requires enucleation, 
exenteration, or bone resection

Tumor is not resectable due to extensive invasion of 
ocular, orbital, craniofacial structures, or brain

Tumor unresectable, extensive invasion:
    Ocular structures
    Orbital structures

Central nervous system
Nasal cavity
Other craniofacial structures
Paranasal sinuses

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T4

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record

Tumor more than 5 mm, but not more than 10 mm in 
greatest dimension or any tumor that invades the tarsal
plate or eyelid margin

Tumor more than 10 mm, but not more than 20 mm in
greatest dimension, or involves full thickness eyelid
